notes: It can't be looted and its corpse cannot be moved. It respawns where its corpse is.<noinclude>{{JSpoiler|All players who sufficiently damage it during the last minute of the fight will receive the [[Slayer of Teneshpar]] [[achievement]].}}</noinclude>
abilities: {{Ability List| {{Melee|0-550}}|{{Ability|[[Avalanche]]|0-300?|element=?}}|{{Ability|[[Drunkenness]]|element=drunk}}|{{Ability|[[Invisibility]]|element=invisible}}|{{Ability|[[Sudden Death Rune]]|0-400?|element=death}}|{{Ability|[[Drowning]]|45 turns of 20 damage; 900 damage total|element=drowning}}|{{Healing|range=350-450}} }}
name: Teneshpar
location: [[Folda]], behind the portal {{Mapper Coords|124.221|123.96|7|1|text=here}}, during the [[Rise of Devovorga]] [[World Quest]]. Can be fought on [[Vengoth]] during the [[Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change]].
strategy:
'''Sorcerers and Druids''': [[Glacier Set]] will reduce [[Ice Damage]], but this is not necessary. You will need to heal after each hit as Teneshpar has various strong attacks, and using [[Magic Shield]] is recommendable. Heal the blocker and throw all the fire, ice, energy and earth spells you have at it.
'''Knights and Paladins''': Since this creature is immune to [[Physical Damage]], you'll have a hard time killing it. It's advised to throw several [[Fire Bomb Rune|Fire Bomb]]s on the floor next to each other and then make Teneshpar chase you back and forth on the middle row. Also bring some [[Great Fireball Rune]]s to deal some extra damage. If the fire fields get weaker, just cover them with some new Fire Bombs. Knights and Paladins of level 130 or above killing Teneshpar during [[Devovorga's Essence Mini World Change]] should wear [[Firewalker Boots]] (PvP) to minimise the damage they take from their fields.
